    'test': [

    'installable': True

from odoo.exceptions import UserError, ValidationError

record/base.action.rule.body:
<record id="${1/(([A-Za-z0-9])|([^A-Za-z0-9]+))/(?2:\l$2)(?3:\_)/g}" model="base.action.rule">
    <field name="name">${1:Human readable name}</field>
    <field name="active" eval="${2:True}" />
    <field name="sequence" eval="${3:0}" />
    <field name="server_action_ids" eval="[(4, ref('${4:ir.actions.server}'))]" />
    <field name="model_id" ref="${5:ir.model}" />
    <field name="kind">${6:on_create_or_write}</field>
    <field name="trg_date_id" ref="${7:ir.model.fields}" />
    <field name="trg_date_range" eval="${8:0}" />
    <field name="trg_date_range_type">${9:day}</field>${11:
    <field name="trg_date_calendar_id" ref="${10:resource.calendar}" />}${13:
    <field name="filter_id" ref="${12:ir.filters}" />}${15:
    <field name="filter_pre_id" ref="${14:ir.filters}" />}${17:
    <field name="act_user_id" ref="${16:base.user_root}" />}${19:
    <field name="act_followers" eval="[(4, ref('${18:res.partner}'))]" />}
</record>${0}

record/ir.actions.act_window.body:
<record id="action_${1/(([A-Za-z0-9])|([^A-Za-z0-9]+))/(?2:\l$2)(?3:\_)/g}_act_window" model="ir.actions.act_window">
    <field name="type">ir.actions.act_window</field>
    <field name="name">${1:Human readable name}</field>
    <field name="res_model">${2:model.name}</field>
    <field name="view_mode">${3:tree,form}</field>
    <field name="view_type">${4:form}</field>
    <field name="target">${5:current}</field>${7:
    <field name="domain">[${6:}]</field>}${9:
    <field name="context">${8:\{\}}</field>}${11:
    <field name="search_view_id" ref="${10:ir.ui.view}" />}
</record>${0}

record/ir.actions.act_window.view.body:
<record id="action_${1/[^a-zA-Z]+/\_/g}_${2/[^a-zA-Z]+/\_/g}" model="ir.actions.act_window.view">
    <field name="act_window_id" ref="${1:ir.actions.act_window}" />
    <field name="view_id" ref="${2:ir.ui.view}" />
    <field name="view_mode">${3:tree}</field>
    <field name="sequence" eval="${4:1}" />
    <field name="multi" eval="${5:False}" />
</record>

record/ir.actions.report.xml.body:
<record id="action_report_${1/(([A-Za-z0-9])|([^A-Za-z0-9]+))/(?2:\l$2)(?3:\_)/g}" model="ir.actions.report.xml">
    <field name="name">${1:Human readable name}</field>
    <field name="model">${2:model.name}</field>
    <field name="report_type">${3:qweb-pdf}</field>
    <field name="report_name">${4:out_filename}</field>
    <field name="attachment_use" eval="${5:True}" />
    <field name="attachment">${6:(object.name+'.pdf')}</field>
    <field name="paperformat_id" ref="${7:report.paperformat_euro}" />${9:
    <field name="help">${8:Something about ${1}}</field>}
</record>${0}

record/ir.actions.server.body:
<record id="action_${1/(([A-Za-z0-9])|([^A-Za-z0-9]+))/(?2:\l$2)(?3:\_)/g}_server" model="ir.actions.server">
    <field name="type">ir.actions.server</field>
    <field name="name">${1:Human readable name}</field>
    <field name="model_id" ref="${2:ir.model}" />
    <field name="condition" eval="${3:True}" />
    <field name="sequence" eval="${4:5}" />
    <field name="context" eval="${5:\{\}}" />
    <field name="action_id" ref="${6:ir.actions.actions}" />
</record>${0}
record/ir.actions.server.description: Common record definition for ir.actions.server, invoking a client action

record/ir.actions.server1.body:
<record id="action_${1/(([A-Za-z0-9])|([^A-Za-z0-9]+))/(?2:\l$2)(?3:\_)/g}_server" model="ir.actions.server">
    <field name="type">ir.actions.server</field>
    <field name="name">${1:Human readable name}</field>
    <field name="model_id" ref="${2:ir.model}" />
    <field name="condition" eval="${3:True}" />
    <field name="sequence" eval="${4:5}" />
    <field name="context" eval="${5:\{\}}" />
    <field name="code">${6:action = self.browse(cr, uid, 1, context=context)}</field>
</record>${0}
record/ir.actions.server1.description: Common record definition for ir.actions.server, running Python code

record/ir.actions.server2.body:
<record id="action_${1/(([A-Za-z0-9])|([^A-Za-z0-9]+))/(?2:\l$2)(?3:\_)/g}_server" model="ir.actions.server">
    <field name="type">ir.actions.server</field>

    <field name="sequence" eval="${4:5}" />
    <field name="context" eval="${5:\{\}}" />
    <field name="child_ids" eval="[(6, ref('${6:ir.actions.server}'))]" />
</record>${0}
record/ir.actions.server2.description: Common record definition for ir.actions.server, executing multiple actions

record/ir.actions.server3.body:

    <field name="name">${1:Human readable name}</field>

    <field name="sequence" eval="${4:5}" />
    <field name="context" eval="${5:\{\}}" />
    <field name="use_create">${6:new}</field>${8:

record/ir.actions.server4.body:
<record id="action_${1/(([A-Za-z0-9])|([^A-Za-z0-9]+))/(?2:\l$2)(?3:\_)/g}_server" model="ir.actions.server">
    <field name="type">ir.actions.server</field>

record/ir.actions.server5.body:
<record id="action_${1/(([A-Za-z0-9])|([^A-Za-z0-9]+))/(?2:\l$2)(?3:\_)/g}_server" model="ir.actions.server">
    <field name="type">ir.actions.server</field>
    <field name="name">${1:Human readable name}</field>
    <field name="model_id" ref="${2:ir.model}" />
    <field name="condition" eval="${3:True}" />

    <field name="context" eval="${5:\{\}}" />
    <field name="wkf_transition_id" ref="${6:workflow.transition}" />
    <field name="use_relational_model">${7:base}</field>${9:
    <field name="wkf_model_id" ref="${8:ir.model}" />}${11:

</record>${0}

record/ir.actions.todo.body:
<record id="action_todo_${1/(([A-Za-z0-9])|([^A-Za-z0-9]+))/(?2:\l$2)(?3:\_)/g}" model="ir.actions.todo">
    <field name="name">${1:Human readable name}</field>
    <field name="type">${2:manual}</field>
    <field name="state">${3:open}</field>
    <field name="sequence" eval="${4:10}" />
    <field name="action_id" ref="${5:ir.actions.actions}" />${7:
    <field name="note">${6:Something about ${1}}</field>}
</record>${0}

record/ir.config_parameter.body:
<record id="${1/[^A-Za-z]/\_/g}" model="ir.config_parameter">
    <field name="key">${1:char}</field>
    <field name="value">${2:text}</field>${4:
    <field name="group_ids" eval="[(4, ref('${3:res.groups}'))]" />}
</record>${0}

record/ir.model.data.body:
<record id="${3/(\.+)/_/g}_${1/(\.+)/_/g}" model="ir.model.data">
    <field name="name">${1:resource_external_id}</field>
    <field name="model">${2:model.name}</field>
    <field name="module">${3:module_name}</field>
    <field name="date_init" eval="${4:time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}" />
    <field name="date_update" eval="${5:time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}" />
    <field name="res_id" eval="${6:1}" />
    <field name="noupdate" eval="${7:True}" />
</record>${0}

record/ir.model.body:
<record id="${1/(\.+)/_/g}_${2/(([A-Za-z0-9])|([^A-Za-z0-9]+))/(?2:\l$2)(?3:\_)/g}" model="ir.model">
    <field name="model">${1:model_name}</field>
    <field name="name">${2:Human readable name}</field>
    <field name="state">${3:Base | Manual}</field>
    <field name="info">${4:Description}</field>
</record>${0}

record/ir.module.category.body:
<record id="module_category_${1/(([A-Za-z0-9])|([^A-Za-z0-9]+))/(?2:\l$2)(?3:\_)/g}" model="ir.module.category">
    <field name="name">${1:Human readable name}</field>
    <field name="sequence" eval="${2:10}" />
    <field name="visible" eval="${3:True}" />
    <field name="description">${4:${1} category}</field>${6:
    <field name="parent_id" ref="${5:ir.module.category}" />}
</record>${0}

record/ir.values.body:
<record id="${1/(([A-Za-z0-9])|([^A-Za-z0-9]+))/(?2:\l$2)(?3:\_)/g}_values" model="ir.values">
    <field name="name">${1:Human readable name}</field>
    <field name="model_id" ref="${2:module.model_external_id}" />
    <field name="model">${2/((^[^.]*.?model_)|([_]+))/(?2:)(?3:\.)/g}</field>
    <field name="value" eval="${4:'ir.actions.act_window,' +str(ref('${3:action_external_id}'))}" />
    <field name="key">${5:action}</field>
    <field name="key2">${6:tree_but_open}</field>${8:
    <field name="action_id" ref="${7:ir.actions.actions}" />}${10:
    <field name="res_id" eval="${9:1}" />}${12:
    <field name="company_id" ref="${11:res.company}" />}${14:
    <field name="user_id" ref="${13:res.users}" />}
</record>${0}

record/email.template.body:
${1:Human readable name} ${2:$1} ${3:$\{object.company_id.name\} <$\{(object.company_id.email or user.email)|safe\}>} ${4:$\{object.name|safe\} <$\{object.email|safe\}>} ${5} ${6} ${8:$\{object.lang\}} To whom it may concern:

} ]]${-1}> ${0}

function.body:
<function eval="[(${3:field}, '=', ${4:value})]" model="${1:model.name}"  name="${2:mothod}">
    <function eval="[(${3:field}, '=', ${4:value})]" model="${1:model.name}"  name="search">
    <value eval="{'${3:field}': ${4:value}}"/>
</function>

file/xml.description: Common base XML structure to be used in Odoo module data files

record/product.product.body:
<record id="${18:${1/(([A-Za-z0-9])|([^A-Za-z0-9]+))/(?2:\l$2)(?3:\_)/g}_product_product}" model="product.product">
    <field name="name">${1:Human readable name}</field>
    <field name="description">${2:Description}</field>
    <field name="description_purchase">${3:${2:Description}}</field>
    <field name="description_sale">${4:${2:Description}}</field>
    <field name="categ_id" ref="${5:product.category}"/>
    <field name="standard_price">${6:0.0}</field>
    <field name="list_price">${7:0.0}</field>
    <field name="type">${8:consu|service}</field>
    <field name="uom_id" ref="${9:product.uom}"/>
    <field name="uom_po_id" ref="${10:product.uom}"/>
    <field name="taxes_id" eval="[(4, ref('${11:account.tax}'))]" />
${13:    <field name="image" type="base64" file="${12:module_name/static/img/file_name.png}"/>
}${15:    <field name="default_code">${14:PRODUCT-CODE}</field>
}${17:    <field name="ean13">${16:0000000000000}</field>
}</record>${0}

record/product.template.body:
<record id="${18:${1/(([A-Za-z0-9])|([^A-Za-z0-9]+))/(?2:\l$2)(?3:\_)/g}_product_template}" model="product.template">
    <field name="name">${1:Human readable name}</field>
    <field name="description">${2:Description}</field>
    <field name="description_purchase">${3:${2:Description}}</field>
    <field name="description_sale">${4:${2:Description}}</field>

    <field name="list_price">${7:0.0}</field>
    <field name="type">${8:consu|service}</field>
    <field name="uom_id" ref="${9:product.uom}"/>
    <field name="uom_po_id" ref="${10:product.uom}"/>
    <field name="taxes_id" eval="[(4, ref('${11:account.tax}'))]" />
${13:    <field name="image" type="base64" file="${12:module_name/static/img/file_name.png}"/>
}${15:    <field name="default_code">${14:PRODUCT-CODE}</field>
}${17:    <field name="ean13">${16:0000000000000}</field>

selection_element.description: Field attribute: selection add new element

model/model.body:
class ${1:ModelName}(models.Model):
    _name = '${3:${1/((^[A-Z])|([A-Z]))/(?2:\l$2)(?3:\.\l$3)/g}}'
    _description = '${4:${1/((^[A-Z])|([A-Z]))/(?2:\u$2)(?3:\ \u$3)/g}}'

    _rec_name = 'name'
    _order = 'name ASC'

    name = fields.Char(
        string='Name',
        required=True,
        default=lambda self: _('New'),
        copy=False
    )

    ${0}

field.company_id.body:
company_id = fields.Many2one(
    string='Company', 
    comodel_name='res.company', 
    required=True, 
    default=lambda self: self.env.user.company_id
)

method/_browse.body:
@classmethod
def _browse(cls, env, ids):
    """ Returns a recordset for the ids provided as parameter in the current
        environment.

        Can take no ids, a single id or a sequence of ids.

        :param cls: model class
        :param env: environment
        :param ids: none, a single id or a sequence of ids

        :return: a recordset
    """

    result = ${1:class_name}._browse(env, ids)
    ${0}
    return result

method/fields_get.description: fields_get remove fields from search and groubby

method/init.body:
def init(self):
    """ Build database view which will be used as module origin

    """
    self._sql_query = """
        SELECT
            ROW_NUMBER() OVER() AS "id"
    """

    tools.drop_view_if_exists(self._cr, ${1:self._table})
    self._cr.execute(
        'create or replace view {} as ({})'.format(
            ${1},
            self._sql_query
        )
    )${0}

method/_search.body:
def _search_${1: field}(self, operator, value):
    return [('${2:related}', operator, value)]${0}

feature/company_plant.body:
plant_id = fields.Many2one(
    string='Plant',
    comodel_name='res.company',
    required=True,
    default=lambda self: self.env.user.company_id,
    domain=lambda self: [('is_plant','=',True), ('id','in',self.env.user.company_ids.ids)],
)

company_id = fields.Many2one(
    string='Company',
    comodel_name='res.company',
    ondelete='set null',
    related='factory_id.parent_id',
)

def/log.body:
def _log(self, level, msg_format, *args, **kwargs):
    """ Outputs an formated string in log

        :param level (int): 1=> debug, 2=> info, 3=> warning, 4=> error
        :param message (basestring): name of the message
    """

    methods = ['debug', 'info', 'warning', 'error']
    log = getattr(_logger, methods[level])

    msg = msg_format.format(*args, **kwargs)
    log(msg)

    <field name="model_id" ref="${1:ir.model}"/>
    <field name="group_id" ref="${2:res.groups}"/>
    <field name="perm_read" eval="${3:True}" />
    <field name="perm_create" eval="${4:True}" />
    <field name="perm_write" eval="${5:True}" />
    <field name="perm_unlink" eval="${6:True}" />
    <field name="active" eval="${7:True}" />
</record>${0}

    <field name="perm_create" eval="${6:True}" />
    <field name="perm_write" eval="${7:True}" />
    <field name="perm_unlink" eval="${8:True}" />
    <field name="domain_force">${9:['|',('company_id','=',False),('company_id','child_of',[user.company_id.id])]}</field>
    <field name="active" eval="${10:True}" />
</record>${0}

</record>${0}

<filter string="" name="create_date" domain="[('create_date','>=',(context_today() - datetime.timedelta(days=context_today().weekday())).strftime('%Y-%m-%d'))]"/>
<filter string="" name="create_date" domain="[('create_date','>=',datetime.date(context_today().year,context_today().month,1).strftime('%Y-%m-%d'))]"/>

    <field name="model"></field>
    <field name="type">qweb</field>
    <field name="mode">extension</field>
    <field name="priority" eval="${2:16}" />
    <field name="active" eval="${3:True}" />
    <field name="inherit_id" ref="web.assets_backend" />
    <field name="arch" type="xml">
        <xpath expr="." position="inside">${5:
            <link rel="stylesheet" href="/${1/(([A-Za-z0-9])|([^A-Za-z0-9]+))/(?2:\l$2)(?3:\_)/g}/static/src/css/${4:styles}.css" />}${7:
            <script type="text/javascript" src="/${1/(([A-Za-z0-9])|([^A-Za-z0-9]+))/(?2:\l$2)(?3:\_)/g}/static/src/js/${6:scripts}.js" />}${0}
        </xpath>
    </field>
</record>

view/inherit.body:
<!--

${1:Human readable name}
${1/./=/g}

Inherited Views

- - - - - - - - - ${2/((..)|(.))/(?2:-\ )(?3:-)/g}
- Model: ${2:model}
- Base Module: ${3:module_name}
- Mode: ${4:primary|extension}
- View priority: ${5:16}
- - - - - - - - - ${2/((..)|(.))/(?2:-\ )(?3:-)/g}

-->

<!-- ${4/(^.)/(?1:\u$1)/g} Inherited .:Tree:. view for "${2/(.)/\1/g}" -->
<record id="view_${2/\./\_/g}_tree_inherited" model="ir.ui.view">
    <field name="name">view.${2/\.+/\./g}.tree inherited</field>
    <field name="model">${2/\.+/\./g}</field>
    <!-- Please veryfiy, that the following inherited view really sticks to the naming convention. -->
    <field name="inherit_id" ref="${3:module_name}.view_${2/\./\_/g}_tree" />
    <field name="type">tree</field>
    <field name="mode">${4:primary}</field>
    <field name="priority" eval="${5/(.)/\1/g}" />
    <field name="active" eval="True" />
    <field name="arch" type="xml">
        <xpath expr="//field[@name='${0:name}']" position="after">
            
        </xpath>
    </field>
</record>

<!-- ${4/(^.)/(?1:\u$1)/g} Inherited .:Form:. view for "${2/(.)/\1/g}" -->
<record id="view_${2/\./\_/g}_form_inherited" model="ir.ui.view">
    <field name="name">view.${2/\.+/\./g}.form inherited</field>
    <field name="model">${2/\.+/\./g}</field>
    <!-- Please veryfiy, that the following inherited view really sticks to the naming convention. -->
    <field name="inherit_id" ref="${3:module_name}.view_${2/\./\_/g}_form" />
    <field name="type">form</field>
    <field name="mode">${4:primary}</field>
    <field name="priority" eval="${5/(.)/\1/g}" />
    <field name="active" eval="True" />
    <field name="arch" type="xml">
        <!-- 
        <xpath expr="//field[@name='${0:name}']" position="after">
            
        </xpath>
         -->
    </field>
</record>

<!-- ${4/(^.)/(?1:\u$1)/g} Inherited .:Search:. view for "${2/(.)/\1/g}" -->
<record id="view_${2/\./\_/g}_search_inherited" model="ir.ui.view">
    <field name="name">view.${2/\.+/\./g}.search inherited</field>
    <field name="model">${2/\.+/\./g}</field>
    <!-- Please veryfiy, that the following inherited view really sticks to the naming convention. -->
    <field name="inherit_id" ref="${3:module_name}.view_${2/\./\_/g}_search" />
    <field name="type">search</field>
    <field name="mode">${4:primary}</field>
    <field name="priority" eval="${5/(.)/\1/g}" />
    <field name="active" eval="True" />
    <field name="arch" type="xml">
        <!-- 
        <xpath expr="//field[@name='${0:name}']" position="after">
            
        </xpath>
        -->
    </field>
</record>
